intro: Bernoullia rivalis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the family. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often growing in a basal rosette. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassy or rocky habitats.
